name: github
description: MCP server for GitHub API integration providing repository management, issue tracking, PR operations, and code search

tools.name: create_or_update_file
tools.description: Create or update a single file in a GitHub repository. This tool will create a new file if it doesn't exist or update an existing file. If updating, you should provide the current file's SHA (obtained via get_file_contents). If the file already exists and no SHA is provided, the operation will fail.

path.description: Path where to create/update the file

content.description: Content of the file (will be base64 encoded automatically)

branch.description: Branch to create/update the file in (defaults to repo's default branch)

sha.description: SHA of the file being replaced (required when updating existing files)

tools.name: search_repositories
tools.description: Search for GitHub repositories. Returns a list of repositories matching the search query, sorted by best match. You can filter by language, stars, topics, and more using GitHub's search syntax.

perPage.description: Number of results per page, max 100 (default: 30)

tools.name: create_repository
tools.description: Create a new GitHub repository in your account or organization. You can specify visibility (public/private), initialize with README, add .gitignore and license.

private.description: Whether the repository should be private (default: false)

tools.name: get_file_contents
tools.description: Get the contents of a file or directory from a GitHub repository. For files, returns the content and metadata. For directories, returns a list of files.

branch.description: Branch name (defaults to repo's default branch)

tools.name: create_issue
tools.description: Create a new issue in a GitHub repository. Issues are used for tracking bugs, feature requests, and other tasks.

tools.name: create_pull_request
tools.description: Create a new pull request in a GitHub repository. Pull requests let you propose changes and request review before merging into the main branch.

base.description: The branch to merge into (target branch)

tools.name: fork_repository
tools.description: Fork a GitHub repository to your account or specified organization. Creates a copy of the repository that you can modify independently.

organization.description: Organization to fork to (optional, defaults to your personal account)

tools.name: create_branch
tools.description: Create a new branch in a GitHub repository from an existing branch or commit.

from_branch.description: Source branch to create from (defaults to repo's default branch)
